questions.question: What is the definition of calibration

answers.a: Calibration is the process of configuring an instrument to provide a result for a sample within an acceptable range
answers.b: Calibration is configuring and verifying a measuring instrument's accuracy to ensure its readings match a known standard
answers.c: Calibration means comparing with standard device and adjusting it for accuracy within the limit

answers.a: Traceability is the ability to identify and follow something or someone, or to keep track of information
answers.b: Traceability in calibration is the ability to link the readings of a measuring instrument to a known reference standard
answers.c: Traceability means knowing and documenting the reference instrument used for calibration of device under test
